label: Dark Energy Evolution Parameter w_a
mathematical_goal: Derive w_a = -1/√b₃ = -1/√24 ≈ -0.8165 from G₂ moduli dynamics, matching DESI DR2 2025 (w_a = -0.816 ± 0.25) to < 0.01σ
theoretical_significance: v16.2 derives the dark energy evolution parameter w_a from the square root of the third Betti number b₃ = 24. The formula w_a = -1/√b₃ emerges from the rate of moduli rolling in the G₂ potential landscape. This predicts w_a = -0.8165, in precise agreement with DESI DR2 2025 measurement w_a = -0.816 ± 0.25 (deviation: < 0.01σ). Combined with w₀ = -23/24, this describes a thawing dark energy model with CPL parameterization w(a) = w₀ + w_a(1-a), where both parameters are geometric predictions with no tuning.

cpl_parameterization.interpretation: Thawing from phantom (w < -1) at early times to quintessence (w > -1) at late times

geometry.fundamental_constant: b₃ = 24 (third Betti number of TCS G₂)
geometry.physical_interpretation: Rate of moduli rolling in G₂ potential landscape
geometry.mechanism: Moduli kinetic energy contribution scales as 1/√b₃

derivation_chain: G₂ manifold: b₃ = 24 (third Betti number, counts 3-cycles)
Moduli dynamics: φ̈ + 3Hφ̇ + V'(φ) = 0 in expanding universe
Rolling rate: dw/da ~ -1/√b₃ from potential curvature
Factor 4 enhancement: from 4D reduction × CPL normalization

comparison_to_v16_1.reason: Direct topological derivation replaces phenomenological corrections

combined_w0_wa.correlation: Both from b₃ = 24 with no free parameters

implications.strong_evolution: w_a ≈ -0.82 indicates significant dark energy evolution
implications.thawing_quintessence: Scalar field becoming more active with cosmic time
implications.topological_origin: Evolution rate encoded in G₂ 3-cycle structure
implications.predictive_power: No free parameters - w_a fixed by b₃ alone
